conclusion: Analyze paths from sources A, B, and C to containers D and E.
Liquid starts from source A and flows downwards.
Liquid from A encounters gray baffle slanted to the right.
Liquid from A moves to the right following gray baffle.
Liquid from A hits green baffle slanted to the left.
Liquid from A moves to the left following green baffle.
Liquid from A reaches orange baffle slanted to the right.
Liquid from A moves to the right following orange baffle towards container D.
Liquid starts from source B and flows downwards.
Liquid from B encounters cyan baffle slanted to the left.
Liquid from B moves to the left following cyan baffle.
Liquid from B hits black baffle slanted to the right.
Liquid from B moves to the right following black baffle.
Liquid from B reaches purple baffle slanted to the left.
Liquid from B moves to the left following purple baffle towards container E.
Liquid starts from source C and flows downwards.
Liquid from C encounters cyan baffle slanted to the left.
Liquid from C moves to the left following cyan baffle.
Liquid from C hits black baffle slanted to the right.
Liquid from C moves to the right following black baffle.
Liquid from C reaches purple baffle slanted to the left.
Liquid from C moves to the left following purple baffle towards container E.
Liquid from source A will flow into container D.
Liquid from sources B and C will flow into container E.
